(On loan from [[Bayer 04 Leverkusen]]) | clubnumber = 7 | position = [[Midfielder|Defensive midfielder]] / [[Defender (association football)|Full back]] | youthyears1 = 1999â2001 | youthclubs1 = FC Maebashi | youthyears2 = 2002â2004 | youthclubs2 = Maebashi Ikuei High School | years1 = 2005â2010 | clubs1 = [[Urawa Red Diamonds]] | caps1 = 126 | goals1 = 6 | years2 = 2011â | clubs2 = [[Bayer 04 Leverkusen]] | caps2 = 0 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2011â | clubs3 = â [[FC Augsburg]] (loan) | caps3 = 20 | goals3 = 3 | nationalyears1 = 2006â2008 | nationalteam1 = [[Japan national under-23 football team|Japan U23]] | nationalcaps1 = 10 | nationalgoals1 = 1 | nationalyears2 = 2010â | nationalteam2 = [[Japan national football team|Japan]] | nationalcaps2 = 6 | nationalgoals2 = 1 | pcupdate = 00:51, 29 November 2011 (UTC) | ntupdate = 1 June 2011 }} {{Nihongo|'''Hajime Hosogai'''|ç´°è² è|Hosogai Hajime|born 10 June 1986 in [[Maebashi, Gunma]], [[Japan]]}} is a [[Japanese people|Japanese]] [[Association football|footballer]]. He is a flexible player, able to play in his natural role as defensive midfielder, defender as well as right wing, and plays for [[FuÃball-Bundesliga|Bundesliga]] side [[FC Augsburg]] on loan from [[Bayer 04 Leverkusen]].{{Cite web|publisher=[[Guardian.co.uk]]|title=Stats Centre: Hajime Hosogai Facts|url=http://guardian.touch-line.com/StatsCentre.asp?CTID=63&CPID=147&TEID=3543&PLID=189840&pStr=Player|accessdate=11 June 2009}} ==Club career== Hosogai was amongst the most promising players of [[Urawa Red Diamonds]]. Having helped the Red Diamonds to the [[AFC Champions League]] in [[2007 AFC Champions League|2007]], he played for Urawa at the [[2007 FIFA Club World Cup]]. On 23 December 2010, he left Japan and transferred to the German club [[Bayer 04 Leverkusen]], who promptly loaned him out to [[FC Augsburg]].{{cite web|title=FCA leiht Japaner Hosogai aus|trans_title=FCA loans Japanese player Hosogai|language=German|date=23 December 2010|accessdate=23 December 2010|publisher=[[Deutsche Fussball Liga|DFL]]|url=http://www.bundesliga.de/de/liga2/news/2010/index.php?f=0000171714.php}} On September 9, 2011 He scored his first Bundesliga goal against Leverkusen. ==International career== Hosogai has represented Japan at numerous youth levels. He was a member of the Japan team for the [[Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics â Men's tournament|2008 Summer Olympics]] finals,{{Cite web|publisher=Sports Reference|title=Hajime Hosogai Biography and Statistics|url=http://www.sports-reference.com/olympics/athletes/ho/hajime-hosogai-1.html|accessdate=11 June 2009}} and made his debut for the [[Japan national football team|Japan national team]] in a 1â0 win against [[Paraguay national football team|Paraguay]] (playing in his natural role as central midfielder) at his [[Saitama Stadium|home stadium]] in [[Saitama, Saitama|Saitama]] on 4 September 2010, after being called up for the first time by caretaker [[Hiromi Hara]] and under the auspices of new manager [[Alberto Zaccheroni]].{{Cite web|url=http://search.japantimes.co.jp/cgi-bin/sw20100903a1.html|title=Zaccheroni issues challenge to Blue Samurai|author=Gus Fielding|work=Kyodo News|date=3 September 2010 |accessdate=5 September 2010}}{{Cite web|url=http://search.japantimes.co.jp/cgi-bin/sw20100905a1.html|title=Kagawa's goal lifts Japan in rematch against Paraguay|author=Andrew McKirdy|publisher=[[The Japan Times]]|date=5 September 2010|accessdate=5 September 2010}} He scored his first goal for the senior national team on 25 January 2011 in the [[2011 AFC Asian Cup]] semi-final match against [[South Korea national football team|South Korea]]. ==Career statistics== ===Club=== {{updated|29 July 2011}}{{cite web | url = http://uk.soccerway.com/players/hajime-hosogai/5331/ | title = Hajime Hosogai | publisher = Soccerway | accessdate = 29 July 2011}} {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%; text-align:center;" |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !colspan="2"|League !colspan="2"|Cup !colspan="2"|League Cup !colspan="2"|Champions League !colspan="2"|Other[[#notes gs1|1]] !colspan="2"|Total |- !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals |- |rowspan="7"|[[Urawa Red Diamonds]] |[[2005 J.
